sentences.english: The lemon geranium sloughs dry brown leaves at the base of its branches.
sentences.chinese: 柠檬天竺葵枝条底部棕色的枯叶会脱落。

sentences.english: Down in the street a tortoiseshell cat was chasing a dead leaf, " etc."
sentences.chinese: 街道上一只龟甲色的猫正在追逐一片枯叶。

sentences.english: Sometimes I looked out of the window at the grey November afternoon, and saw the rain pouring down on the leafless garden.
sentences.chinese: 月的午后天气阴沉，大雨倾泻在秃枝枯叶的花园里。

sentences.english: The wind rustled the dead leaves.
These insects can simulate dead leaves .
sentences.chinese: 这些虫豸可以假装成枯叶。

sentences.english: The butterfly is on the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 枯叶蝶真是因此而要绝对的绝灭了。

sentences.english: A dead leaf, gone with the wind in the borehole, Dangqi ripples.
sentences.chinese: 一片枯叶，飘于井中，荡起了涟漪。

sentences.english: Dry autumn leaves revolved in your soul.
sentences.chinese: 秋天的枯叶在你心头旋舞。

sentences.english: I know you mean the leaf butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 我知道了，你说的是枯叶蝶吧。

sentences.english: A dead leaf fell in Soapy's lap.
sentences.chinese: 一片枯叶飘落到苏比的膝头。

sentences.english: In the lamplight the withered leaves collect at my feet, and the wind begins to moan.
sentences.chinese: 在月光下，一片片枯叶飘落在地，夜的风呜咽呻吟。

sentences.english: A few seconds later he knocks on the door, kicking at the dried leaves scattered across the porch.
sentences.chinese: 随后他走过去敲门，用脚踢着散落在走廊的枯叶。

sentences.english: If I were a dead leaf thou mightest bear;
sentences.chinese: 假如我是能被你唤起的一片枯叶。

sentences.english: He raked the dead leaves together every morning.
sentences.chinese: 他每天清晨用耙子将枯叶耙到一起。

sentences.english: Spring winds today are blowing in wild eddies, driving dust and dead leaves away.
sentences.chinese: 今天春风猖狂地吹起旋舞，把尘土和枯叶都扫走了。

definition: very slight sound/rustling (onom.)/to stream down (of tears)/luxuriant growth (of vegetation)
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
variant of 枝椏|枝桠[zhi1 ya1]
to wither (and drop off)/to wilt/to pass away
